items.title: Alleged driver in fatal Darwin hit-and-run Pairat Junsomran bailed, allowed by court to travel
items.summary: A 61-year-old dual national charged over a fatal hit-and-run in Darwin has been granted bail, less than 10 days after the crash which claimed the life of a 27-year-old woman.

items.title: Key points to understand US attacks on Venezuela and capture of President Maduro
items.summary: These are the key points to get up to speed with what we know about the US strikes on Venezuela and the current state of play after its president was ousted and removed from the country.

items.title: Moderate chance of cyclone hitting Far North Queensland coast by the weekend, weather bureau forecasts
items.summary: The chance of a tropical low off the Far North Queensland coast developing into a cyclone is increasing from low to moderate by the weekend, according to the weather bureau.

items.title: Langi Kal Kal prison escapee threatens farm worker
items.summary: A farm worker says he was threatened by a man who escaped from Langi Kal Kal prison near Ballarat.

items.title: Autopsy unable to determine cause of Tennant Creek woman's death in custody
items.summary: Police say the cause of a woman's death in a Northern Territory police watch house last month remains "undetermined" following a post-mortem examination conducted on Friday.

items.title: Emergency departments ill-suited for mental health crises, advocates say
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Police investigate burglary at offices of comedy troupe Sooshi Mango
items.summary: The group posted CCTV footage on social media appearing to show a man breaking into an office in Carlton.

items.title: Victoria, SA, NSW brace for 'worst' heatwave since Black Summer
items.summary: Blisteringly high temperatures are expected throughout Victoria and in parts of South Australia and New South Wales.

items.title: Joe Root best since Donald Bradman says Darren Lehmann after second Ashes century on Australian soil
items.summary: Joe Root is hailed as the greatest cricket player since Don Bradman after adding a second century to his tally this Ashes tour.

items.title: NSW residents urged to check if they are owed share of $300m in unclaimed cash
items.summary: Almost $300 million in refunds, dividends and cheques remain unclaimed by households and businesses across New South Wales, with locals urged to take action to secure the money they are owed.

items.title: Trump's Venezuela move assumes his base will support his foreign interventions
items.summary: Donald Trump has long defied political gravity but whether his followers in Congress and the MAGA movement will follow him into a new colonialism is a big gamble.

items.title: Measles alert as Adelaide and Sydney airports among possible exposure sites
items.summary: SA and NSW health authorities have issued alerts about a potential measles exposure risk, after a person with the disease recently caught a flight from Adelaide to Sydney.

items.title: Jacob Elordi and Sarah Snook win at Critics Choice Awards
items.summary: Australian actress Sarah Snook takes out Best Actress in a Limited Series or Movie Made for Television with All Her Fault while Australian Jacob Elordi takes out Best Supporting Actor for Frankenstein.

items.title: Eels sign Brian Kelly as potential replacement for Zac Lomax ahead of 2026 NRL season
items.summary: In the wake of Zac Lomax's sudden departure, Parramatta makes a move in the player market as it looks to lifts its fortunes.

items.title: Critics Choice Awards 2026 winners: One Battle After Another wins best picture
items.summary: Now in their 31st year, the Critics Choice Awards are historically known to be the most accurate predictor of the Academy Award nominations.

items.title: Tributes flow for founding father of Australian beef industry, Sir Graham McCamley
items.summary: From building one of Queensland's most respected cattle empires and championing the Brahman breed, Sir Graham's lifelong dedication to agriculture and his community was truly remarkable.

items.title: Victorian Liberal Party deputy leader Sam Groth will exit politics at next election
items.summary: Sam Groth, the deputy leader of the Victorian Liberal Party, has announced he will not contest the upcoming state election in November, saying he made his decision after realising that some recent negative public pressure had come from within his own party.

items.title: South-East Asian powers offer strong criticism of US operation in Venezuela
items.summary: Indonesia, Singapore and Malaysia express "grave concern" over the US capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.

items.title: This toad busting group is determined to take back Magnetic Island
items.summary: On a tropical Queensland island, 'toad busters' have decided the cane toad's spread across northern Australia should not be a lost cause.

items.title: Novak Djokovic exits Professional Tennis Players Association ahead of Australian Open
items.summary: Novak Djokovic is stepping away from the Professional Tennis Players Association citing concerns over transparency and governance within the organisation.

items.title: Ashes 2026 live updates: Australia 2-166, Travis Head 91* after Stokes-Labuschagne clash on day two of fifth Test at SCG
items.summary: Marnus Labuschagne falls two runs short of a Test half-century, nicking off to Ben Stokes immediately after clashing with the England captain.

items.title: Ditching Sydney for a wheat header, French farmer travels 17,000km to pick up where dad left off
items.summary: When 22-year-old Tanguy Bodiguel's friends said they were travelling to Australia, he left them in Sydney to work on a farm with sentimental value.

items.title: Country league president reported to AFL integrity unit over alleged 'gender weirdness' comments
items.summary: A country football league president has been reported to the AFL Integrity Unit over alleged comments about a club's "grooming and gender weirdness" after it was involved in blocking the club from entering a neighbouring competition.

items.title: Is sustainable forestry certification protecting Australia's bushland?
items.summary: Questions are being raised about sustainable timber certification in Australia.

items.title: What is developmental delay and how can you to tell if your child has one?
items.summary: Developmental delay will be a big part of the new NDIS alternative for some kids. But what does the phrase mean and how can you tell if your child has one?

items.title: Higher rate of eviction for community housing residents in WA as decision-making process questioned
items.summary: Community housing is seen as a way for the government to tackle the housing crisis, but between limited options and court orders, some people are falling through the cracks.

items.title: Rufous scrub-bird DNA project aims to safeguard ancient and elusive songbird
items.summary: The Rufous scrub-bird is one of the world's oldest surviving species of songbird, but scientists believe fewer than 2,000 of the birds remain.

items.title: Motorcyclist killed in crash that forced closure of lanes on South Eastern Freeway
items.summary: A 25-year-old motorcyclist has died in a crash that forced the closure of city-bound lanes on Adelaide's South Eastern Freeway this morning.

items.title: Australia urged to back spinners after Todd Murphy's omission from fifth Ashes Test
items.summary: Leg spinner Mitchell Swepson wants Australian cricket officials and curators to buck the growing trend of producing pitches that heavily favour seam bowlers.

items.title: NT police data shows crime down in Alice Springs, locals worry it will be short-lived
items.summary: After years of negative headlines, crime rates in Alice Springs are showing signs of turning a corner but some locals remain worried the change could be short-lived.

items.title: This sacred 'forbidden island' in Japan is World Heritage listed and completely off limits to women
items.summary: Boasting thousands of years of history and a World Heritage listing, Okinoshima is Japan's very own treasure island. It's also completely off limits to women.

items.title: First stock loss figures reported as Western River at Winton reaches major flood level
items.summary: As widespread flooding maintains its grip on north-west Queensland, thousands of livestock are reported missing or dead.

items.title: Emergency departments ill-suited for mental health crises, advocates say
items.summary: A 24-year-old NSW border resident says dismissive treatment in hospitals, long waits for care and limited access to services have pushed her away from support.

items.title: Daria Kasatkina defeated at Brisbane International as Ajla Tomljanović reaches second round
items.summary: Daria Kasatkina admits she held back tears and dealt with severe nerves during an agonising three-set loss at the Brisbane International.

items.title: National donor conception register would prevent 'potential trauma', advocate says
items.summary: Hundreds of people have accessed South Australia's Donor Conception Register in its first year, lifting decades of secrecy surrounding anonymous donations — an outcome that has prompted calls from a leading advocate for similar moves at national level.

items.title: Value of Australian dollar now dependent on interest rates, commodities prices and geopolitics
items.summary: The value of Australia's currency could move significantly up or down depending on the direction of interest rates. But the global economic backdrop will also be crucial in determining its direction.

items.title: Repeated brain injuries linked to memory changes in intimate partner violence survivors, study finds
items.summary: An Australian-first study finds evidence of previously undetected, long-term cognitive changes in women more than six months after they experienced repeated concussions and strangulation during intimate partner violence.

items.title: Inflation, tariffs, EVs: What the ABC's business experts are watching in 2026
items.summary: What are you watching in 2026 when it comes to the economy or markets? That's the question we put to the ABC's experts.

items.title: Cookbook Club Naarm is bringing strangers together over food
items.summary: Each month, strangers and friends meet to share dishes from a chosen cookbook. But Cookbook Club Naarm is more than a foodie feast, it's a reminder of food's power to bring us together.

items.title: Thanasi Kokkinakis tears up and Nick Kyrgios chills out as Special Ks return at Brisbane International
items.summary: Thanasi Kokkinakis said he didn't think he'd be able to return to tennis after a 2025 blighted by injury. Instead he's made a winning return alongside doubles partner and all-round showman Nick Kyrgios.

items.title: Australian cricket great Damien Martyn awakes from induced coma after falling ill with meningitis
items.summary: Former Australian Test batsman Damien Martyn is awake and talking after being in an induced coma for several days.

items.title: Weary Australia eyes Ashes finish line at the SCG as England senses opportunity
items.summary: Only the rain could slow England's progress on day one in Sydney, as a weary Australia reflected its coach's claims the series really ended in Adelaide.

items.title: SCG pays tribute to Bondi heroes, weather frustrates and Australia goes spinless — quick hits from day one of fifth Test
items.summary: Australia opts not to pick a spinner for another Test, breaking a streak of 138 years at the SCG, which rises as one to honour the heroes of the Bondi terror attack. Here are the quick hits from the Ashes.

items.title: Evonne Goolagong Cawley's life story immortalised in screen drama
items.summary: Lila McGuire on the pressure and joy of playing former world number one and winner of seven grand slam singles titles, tennis legend Evonne Goolagong Cawley.

items.title: Death in custody investigation launched after fatal crash on SA rural highway
items.summary: Police launch a death in custody investigation, after a 33-year-old man was killed in a crash in an allegedly stolen car that was road-spiked on South Australia's Eyre Highway.

items.title: US makes 'bold' grab for oil as financial markets brace for price change
items.summary: Oil futures do not trade until Monday, Australian time, and financial market participants are divided over whether there will be a spike or correction in the price of oil in Asian trade.

items.title: Collector with 50 pinball machines in his shed hopes to create a playable museum
items.summary: This shed in Western Australia is filled wall-to-wall with collectable pinball machines, all in working order. Greg Sharp hopes to one day share it as a playable pinball museum.

items.title: Ashes 2026: Bad light halts England's charge as Harry Brook and Joe Root dominate spinless Aussie attack
items.summary: The top two men's Test batters in the world make hay against a spinless Australian attack, only to be stopped by the weather.

items.title: Top End dams overflow as parks come to life in the wake of Cyclone Fina
items.summary: The Northern Territory's Top End has been transformed into a lush green paradise by a cyclone and a monsoon that have brought an unusually heavy start to the annual wet season.

items.title: Two killed in ATV crash on Murchison Highway on Tasmania's west coast
items.summary: A 16-year-old girl from interstate and a 38-year-old Rosebery man, who were both on an all-terrain vehicle, died at the scene on the Murchison Highway after a collision with a ute.

items.title: How artificial intelligence is being used across the ACT to provide vital services
items.summary: Artificial intelligence is a controversial subject, but as the debate rages it is already being used by ACT government departments, doctors and the people running firefighting operations.

items.title: Former North Melbourne AFL player Phoenix Spicer dies aged 23
items.summary: Phoenix Spicer, who played 12 AFL matches for North Melbourne, has died at the age of 23.

items.title: Scientists, landowners working on Tasmania's Bruny Island to help forty-spotted pardalote species
items.summary: Donning a helmet and a well-equipped harness, Dr Fernanda Alves looks like she is set to take on an extreme sport. Instead, she is climbing trees to check nesting boxes for a tiny and very rare bird.

items.title: Brisbane man aiming to be fastest person from sea level to Mount Everest summit in memory of late mother
items.summary: Oliver Foran struggled with his mental health after losing his mother to cancer. Now, he is training to set a world record while raising money and awareness for youth mental health.

items.title: How Louis Braille’s musical notation system remains relevant 200 years after its invention
items.summary: In the 1820s, Louis Braille devised a raised-dot system of letters, numbers and musical notation. 200 years later, it’s still opening the music world for blind musicians.

items.title: Tumbarumba Rodeo celebrates 80 years of bulls, broncos, thrills and spills
items.summary: As the Tumbarumba Rodeo celebrates its 80th year, the Rial family have held on for the longest ride of them all.

items.title: Calls for universal vision screening tests for all SA preschool children
items.summary: A group of researchers is calling on the South Australian government to implement a universal vision screening program for all children attending preschools or day care centres.

items.title: Man who failed to remove backyard cheese facility told to pay $120,000
items.summary: An Adelaide retiree who continually ignored orders to remove an unauthorised backyard cheesemaking facility from his suburban home is ordered to pay more than $120,000 in costs, after being found guilty of contempt of court.

items.title: Fact or fiction: Did infamous child killers spark the end of Sydney's Macdonaldtown?
items.summary: It's the suburb in Sydney that no longer exists — except for a train station — but did it disappear because of scandalous murders or was it just to increase property prices?

items.title: Alex de Minaur unfazed by United Cup loss to Casper Ruud in Australian Open build-up
items.summary: Alex de Minaur is not concerned about his Australian Open preparations, believing he can "flip that switch" after recording his first career defeat to Casper Ruud.

items.title: Tourists stranded, dozens of roads closed as rain continues in flooded outback Queensland
items.summary: Tourists are stranded in towns dotted across north-west Queensland as rain continues to keep major rivers in flood.
